title: Reflective Thinking Cultivation Blended Learning Program for Sustainable Development Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Conducted in classrooms with digital device (tablet/laptop) access, explores sustainability issues in daily life through language activities, including peer discussions and online collaborative tools

learning_goals: Learners analyze cases that induce cognitive dissonance in controversial topics related to sustainable development (e.g., eco-friendly energy policies) and critically reassess their existing perceptions based on these analyses

Learners can linguistically express multidimensional perspectives on sustainability practices through collaborative reflection with peers in a blended learning environment (online discussions + offline workshops)
Through project-based assessment, learners can concretely propose actionable language communication strategies (e.g., campaign proposal writing) to address local community sustainability issues

resources: Access permissions for online collaboration platform (LMS)
Multilingual Sustainability Resources (Newspaper Articles, Videos, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
